titleStmt.title: B. B. Weidler et al. to Unknown
CWG9796

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p: We whose names are hereto signed know well L Hock & have Known him for many years He is a man of good habits & honest & industrious. He is a man without property but is a laboring man his business being that of brick Laying his age is about twenty six years old. & is a German as was is the man with whom he had the difficulty

B. B. Weidler
S, W, Sencen
A Droscher
Jos. Birkle
John Hasemeier
J N Myers
Francis Migrose,
I know personally those whose names appear above, they are men of character. of truth & veracity & can be relied on in all their Statements

I C Howard
Justice of th Peace for Kenton ^County^
